Name: Drive-Rite
Description:
Drive-Rite 
(Recommended Age 6 to Adult)

"Test Yourself 
In a Game of Fun
Drive A Car
Like it Should be Done"

Drive-Rite is a basic roll and move game where each player competes to move their car down the path and be the first to reach "home".

Movement is accomplished by rolling two 6-sided dice to determine your speed.  Each road along the board has a posted speed limit.  If on your turn, you exceed the speed limit, you have to roll another dice and move that many spaces backwards as a penalty for speeding.  There are a few different routes you may take (each with different speeds) as well as various spaces on the board where you must stop.

Overall the game is very simple and there is little strategy.

Name: Flip Flap Flop
Description: A card game of 48 cards with every card having the picture of a cartoony face on it.  The face, however, is slightly different on each card and there are eight sets of different expressions with six cards of each expression.  The cards are dealt to all players face down to make a deck.  Each turn all players simultaneously reveal the top card of their deck.  If a player notices three identical faces he yells out "Flip Flap Flop".  If correct, that player takes the three identical cards. Unclaimed cards are left on the table. A player who makes an incorrect call may not call on the following round but must play a card as usual.  When one player has six sets of FLIP FLAP FLOP cards, the game ends.  Players count their cards and the player with the most cards wins.

Name: Ärligt talat...
Description: "Ärligt talat" (Honestly spoken) is a Swedish trivia game that tells the truth about what your friends like and don't like.

Name: Elsie's Milkman Game
Description:
This game was manufactured as a promotional item for Bordens Dairy

Object of the game is to unload/deliver the contents of their delivery truck to residences or the Supermarket and be the first to return to the Dairy.

Each player takes 1 Truck card and places small product cards representing assorted dairy products in their respective spaces.

Colored pawns represent the trucks as they move about the board making deliveries.

Dice rolls determine movement.

Each residence has symbols representing a delivery request. Landing exactly on a doorstep allows for product delivery and once all products have been delivered to that residence the order can not be duplicated. Any player may unload at the supermarket.

Players must observe street direction arrows and may only go in the direction or directions indicated.

There are also special instruction cards that effect game play.

Name: Destination Delhi!
Description:
Destination Delhi! is a roll-and-move game where players are taxi drivers collecting fares around Delhi. The game board is a map of Delhi featuring 10 different tourist attractions and players draw destination cards telling them where they must move to next. The attractions are:

Rashtrapthi Bhawan
Red Fort
Bahai Temple
Connaught Place
India Gate
Jama Masjid
Janter Manter
Lodi Gardens
Qurb Minar
Raj Ghat

Name: Mister Whiskers and the Wrigleybottom Jewel Robbery
Description:
A game in the same vein as 'Mad Libs':

A chosen player becomes the narrator, who reads the 'crime story'. When the narrator comes to a blank in the text, the active player (which may include the narrator) draws a card from the deck and quickly reads it aloud.

The cards contain words which tend toward absurdist relationships with the rest of the text of the story. Some of the cards are worth points to the player who drew them.

The game also features 30 blank cards, for you to supply the names of friends, etc.

The winner is the player with the most points (which were gained from random card draw). The game is therefore entirely random as presented.

Name: Bombshells
Description:
Armed with a ren faire costume and a Player's Handbook, you've decided to cross the final frontier: dating. Vie for the attentions of the bombshells, but watch out... who knows what mood they're in.

On a player's turn, a Bombshell is chosen that the players will vie for. Each player who wants to approach the Bombshell places one of their Offer cards face down, within the range of cards that the Bombshell will accept.

Then the Bombshell's Mood is revealed, which says how the Bombshell is scored and if there's a card limit.

There is a round of adding to offers from those who approached the Bombshell. The offers are revealed, and whoever has the best offer scores the Bombshell.

Name: The Zombies of Los Muerte High
Description:
Zombies have infested Los Muerte High! As your teachers shamble about trying to eat your brains, you begin to formulate a plan. It might just work, but it’s going to take everything in your locker to convince enough students to help get it done.

Two characters come up that provide icons towards completing your plan (which you need at the end of the game) and popularity points.

Players bid a card face down from their hand. Highest bid takes first choice of cards but loses their bid card, second highest bid takes the remaining card and keeps their bid.

However, sometimes a Zombie is among the character cards who makes completing a plan more difficult.

Name: Nerd Trivia
Description:
Most trivia games cover the boring stuff: history, geography, sports... who cares? Nerd Trivia is the first game to tackle trivia about what's truly important: D&D, Lord of the Rings, Star Trek, Star Wars, and much more. It's nerd, or nothing!

The GM reads a category and a difficulty of a trivia question. Bet on which of your friends you think knows the answer. Then the question is read, and everyone answers. Anyone getting it right scores points. If you pick someone who gets it right, score bonus points. If you were the only one to pick that person, score extra points. But if three or more people picked that person, no bonus points...

Name: DHV Round 1
Description:
Drinking. History. Violence. A bar brawl of historical proportions. Round 1 includes two characters: Mahatma Zombie and Sintaclaws, and can be combined with DHV Round 2 to support up to 4 players.

As the attacker, play attacks, struggles, or booze, and the defender plays defends, struggles, or boozes.

Alternate cards until one player chooses to pass, wherein all the cards are resolved in reverse order.

Some cards will be blocked, some cards will be enhanced or reduced based on what was played, and many cards will deal damage to the opponent.

Refill your hand, reverse roles, and continue until sober.

Available from RobotMartini.com.

Combines with:

    DHV Round 2

Name: Nine Months & Counting
Description: Players travel along a track with squares representing the 40 weeks of pregnancy. To advance, they must complete a task such as answering a pregnancy-related trivia question, unscrambling a baby name, or drawing a pregnancy-related item. Complete the game to receive a brand-new baby.

Name: My First Operation
Description:
(From the box description)

"Roly the pig has been a real greedy-guts and gobbled up too much food.

Now he's got tummy ache and needs an operation.

Remove the food from his tummy, but don't hurt him or his snout will light up and he'll squeal!"

Kids version of operation for 4 years old and up.
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Shop 'Til You Drop
Description:
(From the box description):

 Shop Till You Drop is the game where a roll of the die tells you what to drop in and what to take out.  But mind the jittery trolley!

Load up too much and it'll collapse!  But taking things out can be just as tricky.  Carefully does it or Yikes!  You'll send your shopping flying! One false move and you're out!

Name: Fluctuat
Description:
The game is played selling and buying highly coveted items like stones, stamps, and cheese.  The object is to collect the most money.

This is a free print and play game from Neroludic.  Currently only available in French.

Name: Gaia
Description:
In Gaia players add tiles to the ecosystem and make bets on each species.  There five different types of species in the game.

This is a free print and play game from Neuroludic.  It is currently only available in French.

Name: Cloud Wars
Description:
Vermix roared as the zeppelin’s cannons blasted into him, the great dragon screaming in terrible pain as the cannon ball smashed into his armored hide. Any other dragon might have been blow from the skies with such a volley of lead shot, but Vermix was no weakling, but rather one of the true kings of the skies. The wizards of Tor thought they could take the dragon lord’s territory without much of a fight from the might red dragon, but these wizards were fools, for Vermix never surrendered and had yet to lose a battle for control of the clouds that he called home.

This is Cloud Wars', yet another Mini-Game from Bad Baby Production. In Cloud Wars, you and other players take on the role of mighty air ships, eagle riders and lords of cloud castles as you battle for control of the skies above a fantasy world. The first expansion for the Dragon Wars game, now players can lead forces of wizard forged zeppelins and marshal squadrons of might eagle riders. Fully compatible with Dragon War, have fun and battle for the skies.

Using a fast turn based system; the combat is swift, the excitement nail biting and the strategy intense. Do you dare enter the world of dragons, wizards and cannons…

Name: De Ontembare Stad: Het Verraad
Description:
Het Verraad (Treason) is the first expansion to the game De Ontembare Stad (The Indomitable Citadel)

The tactical and strategic alternatives of Treason have grown significantly in comparison to the original "De Ontembare Stad". Luck is just a small factor in the game. The character of the Dark Master is an important new feature in the game, in fact introducing an extra player in the game. Each player becomes a chance to support the dark side or the good side. Investing in dark power increases the attractiveness of the Dark Master. New playing pieces as Watchtowers allow players to defend themselves against the attacks of the Dark Master. Giving money to the church improves the power of the good forces and gives some protection against the Dark forces. New castle cards and income blocks are a valuable new asset to the game, because the players are able to monitor their income in each category.

As the Citadel is prosperous and the number of citizens grows, rumor has it that a dark character will come inside the Citadel's walls. The Dark Master must be countered by the five Grand Masters to save The Citadel from destruction. But which of the Grand Masters are strong enough to withstand the attraction of the dark side. Since each one of them would like to increase their influence in the Citadel, one or more traitors are more likely to reveal their real character when the game draws to a thrilling finale.

Name: The Game of Society
Description: A pretty complicated game considering it was produced in 1874. The Game of Society is written on 55 cards (22 red (virtues), 13 black (vices) and 20 green (neutral) in 4 letters A B C D which stand for Angles, Britons, Celts and Danes the principle components of the Anglo-Saxon race. 2,4, or 6 can play. If played in teams the teams are either 2 or 3 person teams. Deal 7 cards to each player. The top card, called the Providence is then turned over. This determines trumps for that round. if the trump does not suit the person to the left of the dealer that person may say "NOLO" in which case two more cards are dealt to each player and a second Providence card is turned over which must remain trumps for the round, if the card does suit the player he calls "VOLO" and the hand begins. The cards have names on them that relate to their rank in the  suit. Names like Benevolence, Christian, Industry, Press, Villain, Education, Intemperance, Virtues, Man in Home, Woman in home, Debt etc. These cards have value which determines which card wins the trick. Some cards reduce the value of a trick and therefore wind up resulting in a negative valued trick. Virtue cards are positive and vice cards are negatively valued, neutrals are just that and are worth zero. Object is to be the first to get to 7 points.

Name: Schley at Santiago Bay
Description:
From an article in "The Games We Played" by Margaret Hofer.

Schley at Santiago Bay is one of a series of patriotic games inspired by the Spanish-American War. 'Schley at Santiago Bay' celebrated war hero Winfield Scott Schley while teaching players facts about the recent war. Schley, hardly a household name today, was the U.S. Navy commodore in command of the Flying Squadron during the victorious battle at Santiago. An investigation conducted 2 years after the publication of the game found Schley guilty of negligence and misconduct during the battle.

Name: Operation Market Garden
Description: "Operation Market-Garden: Paratroops across the Rhine, September 1944" is the full title.  Game features 400 colorful back printed die-cut counters and a beautiful four section interlocking, mounted, map board.  Has two identical back printed player aid charts featuring terrain and combat resolution charts.  One off board movement chart for the German player allows units to come on the map board. One glossy 35 page rule book (in Japanese).  Best at two players though team play is fun too especially amongst the Allied player.  Game features seven scenarios as well as the campaign game.  From Hobby Japan Co., Ltd. No. 103 is the stock number.

Name: Pillow-Dex
Description:
From an paragraph in Margaret Hofer's book "The games we played"

"In  Pillow Dex, a precursor of "Table Tennis" players volley a balloon over a net stretched across a parlor table. The idea being to keep the balloon from landing on your side of the table. If you can make it land on your opponents side 10 times you win the game. Pillow Dex was one of the most heavily advertised games of the period."

Name: Nine Inning Classic
Description:
Nine Inning Classic is a baseball board game using dice, player cards and charts to determine the results of every play.

Players will pitch, hit, field and run as they did in real life.  You make all the strategy calls.  Make the line ups, decide when to pinch hit, steal, bunt, hit and run, bring the infield in to cut down the runner at home, and more.

Nine Inning Classic plays fast and has the feel and excitement of real baseball!

With Nine Inning Classic, you can play with any player that ever played baseball.  With other games, you need to buy the teams you want to play with, but with Nine Inning Classic, you can make your own player cards.  Just enter the player statistics on your computer and the cards are created almost automatically.

Special Features of Nine Inning Classic
 
    You can make your own player cards.



    On-line user group where you can get free user-made cards, get game enhancements, and chat about the game.



    Unique, optional strategy cards you can play during the game, adding  real fun and gamesmanship.



    Lots of rare plays such as bad calls, hit batters and much more.

Name: Bare It All
Description: A more risque adult party game where the player's witty answers on statement cards drive the fun.

Name: Oh God, You're Getting Married
Description: A party game meant to enliven any adult get-together as participants inject humor into answers on statement cards. Chicago Tribune Honorable Mention.

Name: Bottoms Up
Description:
How freaky are your friends?
    What tacky talents do they possess?
    Can they work as a team to meet any cheeky challenge?
    Find out this and more with this hilarious adult party game
    Includes instructions for non-drinking play


The teams take turns rolling the die and moving the appropriate number of spaces. Team members must take turns rolling on behalf of the team. The challenge categories are Truth or Bare, Perverted Pictures, Sexy Charades and Dirty Tricks. If a team lands on Bottoms Up!, everyone has to down their entire drink. The team may then roll again and continue their turn. Remember, everyone will have a good time if everyone remains safe. Please drink responsibly. There are non-drinking instructions as well. The game contents include everything you need to play except the beverages. Let’s toast to Bottoms Up!  Bottoms Up Party Board Game is manufactured by Topco Sales under a license from Hustler Product.

Name: Happy Feet: Return to Emperor Land
Description: Mumbles son Mumble Jr. Is kidnapped by Joseph Kony into becoming a child soldier. use dice,cards, and your own instincts to locate the troop Mumble Jr has been forced into and take the fight to Joseph Kony himself. Ages 18 and up. Legacy edition coming soon

Name: Aerodrome II
Description:
Aerodrome II is a miniatures game of aerial combat during World War II. Players take roles as pilots in fighters and bombers. Each player controls a 1/100 or 1/144 airplane mounted on antennas allowing planes to be at differing altitudes. The planes move over hexes on a table dueling with other players to shoot each other down.

As with Aerodrome, pilots pilot three moves at a time. There are many more maneuvers that these planes can do as compared to the World War I version. Movements occur simultaneously and pilots may fire on any plane down the hex row that his plane is pointing. Firepower differences between aircraft are simulated by rolling different sided die for determining hits.

Name: Lanko
Description:
In this Polish game the players try to get into the middle of the board. Moving and capturing are like in checkers, however there are some interesting twists: Players can move over their own stone to built a defense more carefully. In the middle of the Board there is an area where the same stones can be played by both partners to create momentum. And the objective is not necessary to eliminate the opponent, but the game can also be won by reaching certain spots on the board.

Home Page: http://lanko.com.pl/
Home Page (at publisher): http://www.bambusspiele.de/spiele/lanko/e_lanko_fr.htm

Name: 7 Answers of Highly Horny People
Description: "What’s on your mind? Compare answers in this 'guess what they’re thinking' poll of 7 horny people. Your imagination is the limit! Includes 52 game cards, 8 pads, 8 pencils, timer and rule sheet."

Name: OOOOOH!
Description: "The orgasmic game for couples! Contains 1 six-sided 'mood' die, 144 color-coded orgasmic encounter cards, 1 climax reward card, 25 blank climax reward sheets, 2 pencils, 2 concealment envelopes, 1 O-R-G-A-S-M-I-C score keeper, 1 scarf, and 1 feather."

Name: Booze, Boobs and Boners
Description: "The adult trivia game with an 'all or nothing' payoff! Most likely a naked one! Includes 52 game cards, 8 score pads, 8 pencils, 200 game chips, reference cards, card holder and rule sheet."

Name: Choose or Lose
Description: "'Touch n’ Feel, Kiss, Get Naked!' Always good advice. This daring stripping game will make any party memorable! Includes 3 dice, rule sheet and a storage tin."

Name: Get Your Rocks Off
Description: "Sexy moves and seductive strategies! Travel a rocky path and act, draw or interact sexually with another player! Includes game board, rule sheet, 2 dice, 24 playing pieces, pencil and pad."

Name: Sex Connects
Description: "'Horny minds think alike!' Do they? Are your thoughts as horny as your partner’s? This lusty word association game lets you find out. Includes 52 game cards, 8 writing pads, 8 pencils, 2 dice, electronic timer and rule sheet."

Name: Talk Dirty to Me, Lover
Description:
From the box:

Talk Dirty To Me, Lover is the original adult "party-down" dirty dice game.  Players or teams compete for points using word dice to form complete sentences. Extra points are givene for dice that are shared in a crossword fashion or for sentences of 5 words or more. A huge selection of words lets any player talk as "sexy" or "dirty" as they please. And if your mouth gets you in trouble, blame it on the dice! A great go-anywhere party game.

Contents:

     Forty-two (42) Six-Sided Word Dice
     1 Two-Minute Sand Timer
     1 Rule Booklet

Name: Kampen om svampen!
Description: Get the most mushrooms by betting, using cards and having luck with the dice.

Name: Solomon's Stones
Description:
Solomon's Stones is a head to head strategy game that is so simple even young children can learn to play.  Nonetheless, the number of permutations allows for quite complex strategies, so it is just as much fun for the serious game player.  Designed as a coffee table show piece, with the stones being natural hematite gemstones, and with instructions printed onto a glossy A5 card.
The object of the game is to force your opponent to take the last of 28 stones.  Players take turns to remove stones from any (but only one) of the rows or columns - all of which cross over each other, until there is only one stone left.

Name: Decade
Description:
From the back of the box:

The aim of the game is to pit your wits against your opponents on the way to being the first to collect a full "decade" of the biggest news stories from the past 40 years.

On the surface, Decade is a feel good game that allows all its players to share in their mutual history. But be warned. There'll be both good news and bad news along the way - making it a game which can both unite and divide its players.

Victory may be only one news story away, but a simple act of sabotage from a cunning opponent can throw the game wide open. Tempers can flair. Being bad can be beautiful. And victory is sweet indeed!

Decade defines the times - the legends, catastrophes, joys, victories, winners and losers. Because of this, it's a game which generations will enjoy for decades.

Name: The Young Talent Time Game
Description:
This is a board game based on the highly successful Australian TV series Young Talent Time which included young stars like Kylie & Dannii Minogue and all the rest of the Young Talent Time Team.

The object of the game is to make your way around the board by obeying the instructions on the cassette tape. The end of the game is when the first player scores 100 points or the 'Game Over' card is revealed.

The credits are as follows: Created and designed by Darryl Cotton and Nir Pizmony. Design & artwork is by Ian Costello. Photography by George Vernon. Tape was recorded at Emerald Hills Studios, South Melbourne. Additional Music by D. Cotton and C. Lim.

Name: Can-do Roo
Description: In Can-Do Roo, players reach into the kangaroo’s pouch and pull out a Fun Card that will tell them to hop to a particular shape or color. Or they might have to act and sound like a dog, frog, cow or other common animal. The 96 Fun Cards in Roo’s pouch also include letters of the alphabet to help children recognize each letter and learn what words start with that letter. If they pick a number card, they will have fun hopping that number of times while counting. Players who successfully complete their Fun Card keep the card, and the player who collects the most Fun Cards wins the game.

Name: Activator
Description:
Activator is an abstract strategy game designed for a piecepack and piecepack pyramids.  It is played on a 4×4 board, and has a few other aspects in common with Plateau.

Players' pieces and stacks move according to the number of pieces in the stack:  A single piece moves one space orthogonally; a double, up to two orthogonally; a triple, up to three orthogonally or diagonally.  Moves may only be through empty spaces.  Pieces and stacks may merge or split as part of their move.  Each player also has one activator, that rides parasitically on the opponent's pieces.  It moves up to four spaces orthogonally, from one opposing piece to another, and it is not considered a piece.

A player's activator empowers her pieces/stacks in the same rank or file to capture opposing an opposing piece/stack when they move.  Additionally, any pieces/stacks in the two spaces where the activation lines of the players' activators cross are immobilized.

You can win the game one of two ways:


     Occupy your opponent's home space with one of your pieces/stacks for an entire round.
     Reduce your opponent's forces to one piece/stack to win immediately.

Name: Army Brats
Description:
Army Brats is a game to be played with a standard piecepack.  The players are in military school, and are trying to get kicked out for excessively poor attendance.  Players can work on getting demerits by getting caught having enough forged absentee passes to skip half or more of a school day (pair through four-of-a-kind), or to dodge homework by missing three or more days in a row of the same class (runs of three or more).

Players acquire these forged passes by moving to an adjacent classroom of the desired subject, and then either dealing with the non-player student in that room, or forcing a trade with another player.  The types of trades you can make depend on the sort of pass you have for your current classroom.

Once a player gets herself "caught" with a demerit-worthy set of passes, she receives more demerits for a strongly incriminating set of passes.

The first player to 20 demerits wins, and is free from the hard military life!

Name: Blackshirt: The Italian Invasion of Egypt, 1940
Description:
From the designer:

"Blackshirt, The Italian Invasion of Egypt, 1940, is a game covering Italy’s invasion of Egypt, before Rommel came to rescue them from their folly. This game uses an updated, and slightly expanded, version of the Bitter Victory game system: no CRT, buckets o’ dice, and cards...a totally new approach to gaming battles that can be learned in five minutes and played in 2-3 hours.

Most of the rules and mechanics will be familiar to anyone who has ever played a wargame. BSO Games, however, has added to this simplicity a combat system that rates units for how many dice they get to roll on their behalf, as well as what kind of dice (small arms or Heavy Weapons). No CRTs, no siree!

The game also uses cards, one deck (of 10) for each player (whose cards are somewhat different from those of the other player) to enhance the game. (They don't "drive" the game and they can be left out, if you’re so inclined.) The cards are part of a Resource system that gives the players a number of points which they can use to buy cards, rally units or bring in Reinforcements. The choice is theirs, but there are far more choices than points.

The cards, themselves, give the players "Opportunities", from using their (or negating their opponent’s) tank capabilities, to getting more supplies, to special Breakthrough and Reaction movement.

Playing time for Blackshirthas averaged less than 3 hours, and the rules are only 6 pages, including rules for playing Solitaire.

Each game of Blackshirt includes Rules, one sheet of Mike Lemick’s colorful cut-and-paste counters, two small decks of cards, and a snappy Pascal da Silva map (in one piece!)"

Available in English or French
1 rules and scenario booklet with historical introduction (8 pages)
1 A3 map of Lybia and Egypt - 20 colored Opportunity Cards - 140 counters (NATO Symbols) -
The Sicily map and the Opportunity Cards have been designed by Pascal Da Silva

Uses the Same System As:

    Bitter Victory


Reimplimented by: Blood & Sand published by Worthington Games

Name: Hammer Horror Forbidden Terrortory
Description:
Players try and rescue a Victim whilst trying to destroy Dracula before he gets uber strong.  Players need to collect  protection to avoid the ghouls dotted around the Count's lair. Players get  five days to complete this task. But beware one bite from a vampire makes you a vampire too!

Game BITS:
3 Decks of cards all showing clips of the famous Hammer Films
12 Hand painted replica figurines of the classic Hammer Monsters
1 Game Board
3 Special Dice
1 DVD Over an hour of Sound and Movie clips that interacts with the game.

Name: Bloomie's: The Game
Description: Each player starts with $1630 and uses the dice to travel around the gameboard buying property. The properties represent Bloomingdale’s department stores around the United States. Houses and hotels from Monopoly are replaced with little and big brown bags. Players can play until all but one player is bankrupt or the richest player is determined to be the winner after a one-hour time limit.

Name: Soldiers of the Negus
Description:
Critical Hit Scenario Pack for ASL

Contents:  4 page historical booklet, 2 rules pages (punched for a 3-ring binder), 8 scenarios, 1 counter sheet

Soldiers of the Negus features 8 scenarios depicting actions from the Italo-Ethiopian War of 1935-1936.  
All the counters are 1/2", a few counters that are normally represented by 5/8" counters (like AT-Guns and snipers) appear in a small version here.

The set includes rules for the Ethiopian Army. They can try to  flip (YES: flip!) over the small Italian tank-ettes.

Name: Bisnes
Description:
Players try to earn money by selling one the products in the game: ice cream, toys, lemonade or candies. Each player has his/her own product. Products are sold by moving the player's truck to a right kind of spot on the board. Truck is moved by throwing two dice.

When a player has enough money he/she can buy another truck to improve his/her possibilities in selling products.

Players can decide the length of the game at the beginning by deciding the sum of money player has to collect to win.

Name: Kaivospeli
Description:
A game of Finnish mining industry where players drill for mine and transport it to refineries or harbors for export. Transportation is done by rolling dice and moving and moving accordingly.

The board is a partial map of Finland with actual locations of Finnish mines in the 1980's. Game has been produced in cooperation with the Finnish mining industry, specifically the companies Outokumpu Oy and Rautaruukki Oy.

The given number of players (1-4) is probably a typo as there is no solo variant in the rules, and the game is totally meaningless if played alone with the rules as they are.

Name: Cromlet
Description:
From the Press Release:

Cromlet is a card game for 2-6 players ages 8 and up.  Timing is everything: cards are played and Cromlets are claimed, but players can try to foil each others moves, and six wild cards in the deck keep everybody guessing in this strategy-heavy card game that takes 30-45 minutes to play.

Name: Mixo
Description:
If one says “the small one of night to you”… Doesn't that speak to you??? But if it is said to you that this expression contains at the same time the beginning of a first expression and the one second end with a common point between the two… Does that inspire to you more??? The small prince… Night flight… Antoine of Exupéry Saint A play with 460 contracted expressions and 920 titles or expressions to be found.

Si l’on vous dit « Le petit de nuit »… Cela ne vous parle pas ???  Mais si l’on vous dit que cette expression contient à la fois le début d’une première expression et la fin d’une seconde avec un point commun entre les deux… Est-ce que cela vous inspire plus ???  Le petit prince… Vol de nuit… Antoine de Saint Exupéry  Un jeu avec 460 expressions contractées et 920 titres ou expressions à retrouver.

Name: Marabout
Description:
Vous connaissez le jeu Marabout… Bout de ficelle… Selle de cheval…. ??? avec, à chaque fois une fin de mot qui va permettre de démarrer un nouveau mot….
Et bien Marabout, c’est çà… On vous propose sur chaque carte 4 mots (2 au recto et 2 au verso) avec pour chaque mot 5 enchaînements imposés à retrouver et c’est parti…
184 mots au total et 920 enchaînements différents….

You know the play Marabout… Boils of string… Saddle of horse…. ??? with, each time an end of word which will make it possible to start a new word…. And well Marabout, it is that… One proposes to you on each chart 4 words (2 with the recto and 2 with the back) with for each word 5 sequences forced to find and it left… 184 words on the whole and 920 different sequences….

Name: Fishing: Jeu De Peche
Description:
The fish are moved from the center pool, out of any exit, on a throw of the dice. Fish always move in a clockwise direction. No fish can pass another or occupy same square.
To be caught a fish must land on the square with a fisherman's hook, and the player must throw again to determine size. If he throws a 1,2 or a 3 the fish is Too Small and has to be thrown back into the center of pool. If he throws a 4,5 or 6 the fish is over the correct size and is kept.  There are other rules to enhance play. First player to catch 3 fish is the winner.

Name: Your Hometown Tycoon Game
Description: Your Hometown Tycoon Game, published by Fun & Games, offers up a gaming experience similar to, or perhaps simpler than monopoly and other basic roll-and-move/property accumulation type games.  Various editions exist each of which are marketed with a local context by including pictures, properties, and business names familiar to specific city (e.g. Madison, WI).  Each edition is identifiable not only by its contents, but also by paste-ups featuring a "hometown" applied to the box front.

Name: Baseball Mania
Description:
From the Rulebook:

BASEBALL MANIA... the boardgame represents an easily understandable and excellent analogy to the real game of baseball - without the injuries.  A game is divided into nine innings.  Each team is allowed a turn at bat per inning until three outs are recorded.  With the third out a team's 'at bat' ends.  The 'Visiting' team is up first each inning - considered the 'top' of inning.  The 'Home' team always bats last or the 'bottom' of the inning.  The team not 'at bat' is the defense.  The team with the greatest number  of runs after nine innings wins.  If the score is tied at the end of regulation play, 'extra innings' are played until at the end of an inning one team leads.  Runs are scored when a runner touches 'Home Plate' preceeded by tagging first base, second base, and third base.  Not more than one player is allowed per base at a time.  Runs, innings, outs, strike and balls are recorded by their respective markers.  Strike outs are noted by the enclosed "K's" and are to be hung over the backboard when a strike out occurs.

Name: Femettan
Description:
The game is for 10 year olds and up.

The players try to explain words to their partners by using only words that starts with the letters on 4 dice throws.

Name: Fantasifararen
Description:
Fantasifararen ("The Fantasy Traveler") is a Swedish game recommended for children 6-12 years old. It is based on a book, "Fantasifararen - Jakten på Kapten Klos ring" that is included in the game box.

The players move along a game board trying to be the firs one to reach the goal. On the way they encounter different challenges. To be the winner you have to use your imagination and be willing to fulfill some dares.

Name: 88: Digital Dramatic
Description:
A game for ages 8-88.
All players play at the same time, trying to change the digital numbers on their display board to get as close as possible to the goal number.

Name: Cortexcape
Description: A French game of moving through a labyrinth. The board is somehow constructed by the players, each choosing the other's goal.

Name: Dinosauriernas hemliga dal
Description:
Dinosauriernas hemliga dal means  " The secret valley of the dinosaurs. "
Two dinosaur families are competing for the power in the secret valley.
This tactical game is recommended from 6 years and up, and works for adults.
In the game, the purpose is to try and catch the opponents dinosaurs while avoiding the other player´s dinosaurs and the bloodthirsty T-Rex who belongs to no one.
The dinosaurs all have different amounts of strength and can´t catch other dinosaurs who are stronger than them selves.

Name: ALLSAFE: The Food Hygiene Board Game
Description: A board game that can be used by food hygiene trainers to teach different aspects of food hygiene, including personal hygiene, microbiological hazards, physical hazards, chemical hazards, food safety facts, Environmental Health Officers and court action regarding business owners, food handlers and consumers.

Name: Fondue
Description:
To become the cheese chasing champion you must be the first to find and collect four cheeses for your fondue in the network of constantly changing cheese passages.

Sounds easy! However, this game of fun and excitement requires tactics and sneakiness - not only will you want to collect your cheeses; you will want to stop your opponents from getting theirs first.

And just when you think that you are tantalizingly close to your fondue, your opponents may invite you to join them on their tile, steal your cheese, change your path or set the cheese thieves on you.

Landing on the stars may help you on your quest to collect cheeses or send you on a wild cheese chase.

Name: Spider-Man & Friends Gotcha Card Game
Description:
The game includes 36 Super Hero cards that portray one of six super heroes on one of six different backgrounds.  In addition, there are six blank background cards and six clear cards that contain an image of one of the super heroes.  During the game's set up, the background cards and the clear super hero cards are randomly put together.  The rest of the cards are dealt out to the players and they form a draw pile in front of each player.

Game play consists of a player drawing his or her top card and displaying it face-up on a shared draw pile.  If the card color and super hero matches any of those displayed on the table, a player yells "Gotcha" and then slaps the pile, taking all the cards below.  If the card does not match any of the combinations, play simply moves to the next player.

The player who gets all the cards wins.  The game also comes with a set of basic rules to play the game with young children.

Name: Joint Efforts: Primary Edition
Description:
Designed by Lancashire County Council’s School and Community Partnerships Team and Youth and Community Service this game was created to help parents, youth workers and other to learn how to deal with drugs.

The board represents the players' school and local community where they encounter situations or questions that challenge their knowledge of substances in the areas of law, personal and professional safety, health and safety, decision making and others.

The winner is the first player who reaches home and answered most questions correctly.

Home Page: http://www.lancsngfl.ac.uk/lses/index.php?category_id=17

Name: Roll-It Tic-Tac-Toe
Description:
From the Patch Products Press Release:

This game is played on nine Tic-Tac-Toe grids. Each of the 81 squares contains random numbers from 1 to 12, not including 2 or 7.

On each turn, players roll two dice, add up the numbers and mark a corresponding number with their color. If a 2 is rolled the the player loses the turn. If a 7 is rolled the player may place a marker on any spot on the board (this is the only way to mark a 1).

If a player marks his or her color on three numbers in a row—either vertically, diagonally or horizontally then they score! Most points wins.

Each player gets one point for each chip on the board, three points for each tic-tac-toe in a mini 3x3 grid, and five points for each grand tic-tac-toe (Three mini tic-tac-toes in a row—horizontally, vertically, or diagonally). The player with the most points is the winner.

The game was created by David Jisa, a Wisconsin teacher who uses games in his classroom to help motivate students. Roll-It Tic-Tac-Toe lets students practice their addition skills and develop problem-solving strategies.

Roll-It Tic-Tac-Toe comes in two versions—one with colored chips and 8 game boards and another with colored markers and game sheets. The game is for 2 to 6 players ages 7 and up.

Name: Cross Purposes
Description: Outmaneuver your opponent's tiles as you race to home territory.

Name: Oopstix
Description: This is a dexterity/balance game with four tall sticks that have little branches on them. On your turn, you hang your own sticks on these which can be straight or wildly curvy.  As you play, any that fall off as a result of playing them become yours to try and put up.  First person to get rid of all of their sticks wins.

Name: Alexander: The Card Game
Description:
Very basic card wargame with a Alexander the Great theme. There are two types of cards: difficulty cards and solution cards. You use the latter to overcome the first.

This is a free PnP game from Warpspawn.
Families: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

Name: Habet, hoc habet!
Description:
Habet, hoc habet! is a game of gladiatorial combat.

Each player controls a gladiator and has attack and defense cards. Each turn each player chooses simultaneously which attack and defense card to play. Cards are played face down and revealed when all cards have been chosen.

The effect of the attack depends on the defense the other player has chosen.

The wounds are represented by reducing hand size - this simulates the fact that the wounded gladiators have reduced possibilities.

All cards are in Latin. The game was developed by a teacher to use in his class.

The game appeared in Battlegames #3 as a free insert.

Name: International Philosophy Grudgematch
Description:
This is a boardgame simulating a football match between teams of French and German Philosophers. The game is more or less what Americans would call soccer, leavened with enough indoor soccer and football to keep the existentialists angsty.

The game is played with a print-out board, counters, and a standard poker deck. Each team consists of four philosophers; each philosopher corresponds to a suit of cards. To make philosophers kick or block the ball, you must play cards of their suit.

IPG is available at:
http://www.fecundity.com/pmagnus/grudgematch/

Name: Beowulf: Skirmish at Heorot
Description:
This is a skirmish game set in the Dark Ages and based on the Beowulf poems.

One player controls the monster Grendel, the other player takes control of Beowulf and his 14 geats (=his warriors).

The setting is Heorot - the hall of the Danish king Hrothgar.

Success of the actions is determined by 6-sided dice. There are different victory conditions for both sides, you can score major or minor victories.

The game appeared in Battlegames #4 as a free insert.

Name: Locuras
Description:
Locuras (spanish word for Craziness) This a Spanish party game that has different categories:

     10 questions (guess the character)
     Logic (Jeroglif, Tangram and logic questions)
     Trivia
     Drawing (based on a specific starring figure)
     Words (9 dice with letters)


A very singular thing about this game, is that it doesn’t have a sand clock for the time. Instead, you have to spin a top.

When you finish your road along the board, you have to do a final "Locura" to win the game (example, eating a raw egg, dance with the game box on your head, etc)

Very good party game

Name: Panzer Grenadier: South Africa's War
Description:
South Africa's War is a supplement to the Panzer Grenadier series, focusing on the actions of these units during 1941. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Panzer Grenadier: Desert Rats to play all of the scenarios, and Afrika Korps: The Desert War â€“ Platoon Level Combat in World War II: A Panzer Grenadier Game, Eastern Front: A Panzer Grenadier Game and  Road to Berlin: Platoon Level Combat in World War II â€“ A Panzer Grenadier Game to play some of them.

Contents include: Comb-bound, 22-page scenario booklet printed on cardstock. Includes special rules for South African troops and 20 new scenarios for the Panzer Grenadier game system. Also included is a sheet of 88 die-cut counters representing the infantry, weapons, vehicles and leaders of South Africa that were engaged in the fighting in North Africa.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series

Name: Boerderij Spel
Description: A children's game where 2 to 6 players try to sell as soon as possible all their animals

Name: Baseball's Board Game
Description: This easy-to-learn game for two players features a baseball-diamond board design and includes two dice, chips that represent players, a scoreboard to keep track of runs and outs, and a statistical sheet to follow up singles, doubles, triples and other plays. It is based on aspects of the baseball game played around the world. The game consists of odd innings (five, seven or nine), and championships can be played by preliminary rounds. Baseball’s Board Game is endorsed by Carlos Lee, Star Game player in 2005 and 2006, MLB Home Run Derby 2005, and current star of the Houston Astros.

Name: Suitors
Description:
You are in love; it can't be helped.  It is one of those things that happens to everyone.  The Problem, in this case , is that you aren't the only one going after you Paramour.  These usurpers will do anything to take the person you care about the most away from you.  So, go forth using all the Power, Money and Love at your disposal to defeat all those who would stand between you and your only One.  Prove you are the best Suitor.
     This is a unique trick taking game where the strongest cards have the least points.  It also includes some special 'power' cards that allow you to do interesting actions.

Name: StarBlazers Fleet Simulator
Description: StarBlazers Fleet Simulator is a set of miniatures rules designed for the StarBlazers Mini Kit series of plastic models (TCI). The game was published in the October/November 1987 combined issue of the Space Gamer and Fantasy Gamer (number 80). The game appears on pages 24-29. A review of the game by Kris James appears on pages 20-21 of the same issue.

Name: Vakantie Quiz
Description:
Vakantie Quiz is a Dutch Quiz game about traveling through Europe.

Depending on the city, the players try to answer a question from different categories.

He, who first answers questions in the different categories correctly is the winner

Name: The Battle for Destainia
Description:
You start off by picking one of the Character cards to determine what type of person you will be. Each Character starts off with items that have different strengths and weaknesses. You must use your items to your advantage in knowing who to attack and who not to attack when and where. This is a game of strategy and the player who is experienced will have a definite advantage over a beginner. It was made so that luck is not as important as skill and strategy. You can bribe the different people in the game to attack your opponents and take their items from them. You may battle opponents when you land on the same square as them deciding which items to use in each different situation. You may warp to different areas of the board using the tunnel either to attack an opponent or strategically move into a position which is more beneficial. Receive money when passing the Castle to be able to buy items when you land on the store squares. Pick up Destainia cards and follow the instructions of the card which may be to your advantage or to your peril. The object of the game is to move along the board purchasing different items from stores along the way. Each item you buy has points, and once you have achieved enough points you will be able to challenge and defeat the Sorcerer. Instead of like other games where you have to be the last player alive, this is a race to the finish where everyone is trying to defeat the Sorcerer and claim the Medallion. The action is fast paced and there is never a dull moment. Destainia the game includes 100% cotton canvas material for the board, 6 different color pawns, 2 dice, 60 plastic coins, a drawstring pouch, instructions, 143 playing cards, and a convenient clear plastic tube to put everything in, which is easy to store.

Home Page:  www.destainia.com

Name: Scooby-Doo! Escape the Phantom Race Game
Description:
Scooby and the gang have come to investigate weird goings on in the Grimly Manor House up on Haunted Hill.  The house is very ancient and inhabited by a ghostly phantom who roams the corridors throwing people he finds out of the house!

A children's roll and move game with a motorized phantom who knocks the players out of the game is he catches them.  The last player to be caught or the first player to make it all the way through the haunted mansion wins.

Ages 4+

Name: Fussball Management
Description:
A German game.
Players are soccer managers who move their playing pieces around the board after rolling the die.
Goal is to make as much money as possible.
Playing time is agreed upon. Suggested time is in between 90 to 180 minutes.

Each one starts with 2500000 DM in paper money. This can be used to invest in players (national or international) and stadiums. These can only be bought/sold when landing on the appropriate space.

Landing on a ball or stadium space means your team is playing a game. If on a ball space or a stadium owned by nobody, the bank pays out the team, looking at the amount and type (national/international) of sportsmen purchased.
If someone does own the stadium 300.000 DM spectator entrance fees are paid by the bank. This is used to pay the visiting team and rent to the owner of the stadium. Some stadiums have a team color and are rented by the managers at the beginning of the game. Until purchased players pay rent to the bank when games are played there.

A fee must be paid every time the starting space is passed
(monthly expenses). Other spaces ("Draw card", "Pay bonuses",...) can also cause loss/gain of money. 
When landing on a shortcut space you must use it. They get  you faster to the starting space, where dues must be paid, but can generate more money.

Name: Thataway!
Description: Priscilla the gorilla is on the loose...Which way did she go?! Track down the escaped ape by following the directions on the cards. Did she go left? Right? Up? Down? Play cards quickly to trace her trail. Be the first to capture Priscilla and score big points. The player with the highest score is the chimp-chasing champ!

Name: Maze of Good & Bad
Description:
An adventure card game that uses 40 cards and nothing else.

From the rules:
"The dreaded Purple Scale Dragon has been terrorizing near by villages. The monster has chosen to make The Maze of Death its lair. You are to intrude this maze and slay the Purple Scale Dragon. Hey tis easier to defeat it when it can't fly away, and you just may catch it when it's still asleep! The maze was created by an evil wizard who after his death  didn't want his magical items and gold to be stolen, it's like his tomb. Rumor is that if you go deep in the maze, you just might encounter......"

Free download from: http://www.angelfire.com/bc3/battlecorona/

Name: Dédales
Description:
Players are heroes trying to get out of the labyrinth. The player who finds the most economic route out wins the game.


    Was availible - Now link doesn't work.


{Available for free download (in French only) from the Neuroludic website: http://www.neuroludic.com/}


     Archive.org download (cut & paste full URL):


http://web.archive.org/web/20070622014854/http://www.neuroludic.com/dedale/dedale.html

Name: The Simpsons: Don't Panic
Description:
From the box:

"The Game of Manic Multi-Tasking Mayhem

An "unknown employee" at the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant was distracted for only a moment. Now the cooling tower is clogged an a chain reaction is ticking toward a catastrophic meltdown!

Players race against the clock to unclog he reactor. But the more you move, the more you have to do... at the same time. Only the most nimble, least distracted, most multi-tasking Player can save Springfield.

Whatever you do, Don't Panic!!!"

Name: Spider-Man Crime Stopper Card Game
Description:
Capture as many villains as you can with the help of your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man!

A game for young and old ages 6+. Comes with 52 jumbo cards with artwork from the various comic book series

Name: Action in the Persian Gulf
Description:
Considered a novel in game form in which you are placed in the position of Convoy Commander who must make decisions such as - warn or shoot down an unidentified aircraft - as your fleet moves through the Persian Gulf to complete it's mission.

Using metal scale models of your convoy, you guide your ships on a map Persian Gulf through hostile aircraft, naval vessels and guided missile batteries - your course and confrontations differ with every game using a ten sided die. The game includes navigation charts and tables outlining the capabilities of each of the ships and weapons in your convoy.

Name: Around the World
Description: Travel! Travel! Travel! The object is to travel around the world by answering questions correctly and gaining tokens to fill up your Global scorecard. Players roll the dice and "travel" according to the number on the dice. Players navigate their travels through the spaces they land on. Players need to correctly answer four questions in each category to win. The first player to "travel around the world" and fill in their Global scorecard wins. The more places you travel the more fun it is to play!

Name: Happy Retirement
Description: The object of the game is to achieve a Happy Retirement by obtaining a balanced lifestyle (an outcome that most people do not achieve in real life). Players acquire lifestyles and an income that are generally beyond a typical person’s means. Players have to make sets consisting of three different types of lifestyles: expensive (e.g., Traveling the world), not so expensive ( e.g., mountain-bike trips), and one that is free (i.e., good friends).

Name: Civil Lore!
Description:
Civil Lore! is the new game where players battle to win the board by using their knowledge of America's cultural lore. We all know trivia - little facts about this and that. Here today, gone tomorrow. Lore is lasting - the neat stories and meaningful facts we love to hear and pass along!

Players stake flags in six fun cultural territories, by answering questions about American cultural lore. Yet watch those flags - others will try to topple them - likely becoming Cannon Fodder themselves!

Name: Action Front! Hakko Ichiu
Description:
December 1941: The Japanese, having crippled the US Pacific Fleet, run rampant through the Southern Pacific.  Island after island, city after city, fall in one of the most remarkably executed plans in military history.  The second ACTION FRONT! game, Hakko Ichiu, pits Japanese SNLF and paratroopers against US and European troops in battles from Wake Island to Malaya.

In a small series with Action Front! Watchtower.

Name: Loose Lips
Description:
From the Patch Products Press Release:

Loose Lips™ is more than a drawing game, more than an acting game and more than a talking game. It's all three games in one.

When you play Loose Lips, you'll give clues by talking in some rounds and acting or drawing in other rounds. Your goal is to get your teammates to guess the answer without letting forbidden similar words slip off their lips. If they guess the right word, your team scores. But if your team has loose lips and says the forbidden words, the other team scores.

Here's an example: If the answer is Hawk and the forbidden Lip Slips are Bird and Buzzard, you'll have to give clues to get your team to say Hawk without saying the similar forbidden words—Bird or Buzzard. And you only have 60 seconds! This fast-paced party game will keep your teammates' lips moving while you talk, act or draw your way through each word.

Loose Lips is played with 4 or more players in 2 teams, ages 12 to adult

Name: Fortress Cassino: The Road to Rome
Description:
(from the front Cover:)

Fortress Cassino comes with a printed full-color 22x39 hex Historical Map of the major Cassino battleground area, 10 scenarios, a 22 screnario Campaign Game, Special Terrain and CG rules, a Fortress Cassino Chapter Divider, and 56 full-color, die-cut, printed and mounted original counters, which include a complete set of New Zealand MMC counters to fight with. But watch out, the New Zealanders are a bit tougher than their British counterparts.

Fortress Cassino is not a complete game. Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1, West of Alamein: ASL Module 5, Kampfgruppe Peiper II: ASL Historical Module 3 and some Red Barricades: ASL Historical Module 1 rules* are required to play this module.

These titles are the property of the Avalon Hill Game Company.  This product is not published or sanctioned by TAHGC.

Name: Waffen-SS II: Fuhrer's Firemen
Description:
From the front cover:

Waffen-SS II: The Fuhrer's Firemen includes either rugged scenarios to be played on your geomorphic map boards.  Also included with this pack is a set of 240 mounted counters beautifully printed in the traditional black of the SS.  These counters round out the "No Quarter, No Glory!" pack by including Early War, Second Line, and Conscript SS counters.  Also included is a special set of white SMC POW's, black CE/BU Turret counters with Panther and Tiger artwork, and Red Berserk counters for every MMC counter type [EXC:Japanese].

As a special bonus a Chapter H page is included containing the necessary rules and notes for a rare set of vehicles found near the Reichstag and others found near Hitler's bunker.  And for those of you who could not resist the urge to put Corporal Hitler into the front lines in your Berlin: Red Vengeance CG we have included a realistic set of rules for this unlikely scenario.

Uses Boards: 2,3,11,12,15,16,18,20,21,22,23,33,35,36,38,43,44,45

Requires:

    ASL Rulebook
    Heat of Battle's Waffen-SS: No Quarter No Glory

Name: Silly'Ables
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Silly'ables is a hilarious word game for 2 to 8 teams, ages 12 to adult. Each team when it’s their turn rolls a die, and by that roll, they’ll know whether they’re trying to solve a one, two, or three syllable word.

There are 500 playing cards in the game, each with a die representation from one to six. If a team tosses a 1 or 4 they will try to solve a one syllable word, toss a 2 or 5 they will try to solve a two syllable word, and finally if they toss a 3 or 6 they will try to solve a three syllable word. On each card there are random pictures of a red die, which are (all play) cards and the remaining picture of dies are in white (for that team only) cards.

Each team will choose their partner to either be the giver or receiver of clues, and will alternate roles each time. No team member can be a giver or receiver more than once in a row. The giver of the clues can draw, do gestures, or give one word clues to get their partner to guess the target word. NO talking other than one word clues!

There are three special symbols that might be on the cards. One that lets your partner know that a word sounds like another. Second, a symbol that indicates that you’re looking for a word opposite of the word given as a clue. Finally third, a hand that shows either one, two, or three fingers which lets your partner know your looking for the first, second, or third syllable of a word to use with other syllables to eventually solve the target word.

Name: FlipQuest: WWII Behind Enemy Lines
Description:
World War II FlipQuest game.

From official website:

The briefing room suddenly becomes quiet as the Colonel walks up to the podium. "Men, we have just deciphered a message from the German High Command to the German Commander in the French town of Nancy. A Company of Special Troops will be arriving with a large shipment of Nazi gold coins. It is their job to hide and guard the gold. To ensure the loyalty of the troops, they are to be paid with that gold." The Colonel stops reading and looks our way. "It seems the Nazis know the war is going badly, and that their Marks will soon be worthless. Your mission will be to relieve the Nazis of as much gold as possible. Unfortunately you will be parachuting into an area that makes extraction quite impossible. You should use whatever resources you have or can find to continue your mission. You may use the gold coins to buy supplies, as long as you keep it from the Nazis. We have contacts in the French Resistance, and that will be how we communicate future missions.”
And So It Begins.....

Home Page: http://www3.sympatico.ca/shadowcraft/Flipww2.html

Name: After Dinner Trivia
Description:
From the publisher:

2,400 questions on totally trivial trivia!
Contains questions, score pad, pencils, dice and picture cards. Can either be played in its own right or used as extra questions for other trivia games Perfect for trivia nuts everywhere!

Name: After Dinner Games
Description:
From the publisher:
This set comprises sixteen entertaining games with which to test and tease your guests over the mints and coffee. On the CD are ten terrific rounds of audio fun whilst on the cards you’ll find six more ‘traditional’ games.

Games include: 
FOOD & DRINK ~ A cornucopia of culinary trivia questions! 
PLAYS & NOVELS ~ Characters from famous plays & novels to identify 
8 P’S IN A G ~ For what do the initials stand in the mystery phrases? 
HOGWASH ~ Weird words and bizarre definitions for you to solve 
MOVIE MAYHEM ~ A challenging collection of celluloid posers 
CHARACTER COUPLETS ~ Find famous folk whose initials match the letter pairs 
QUOTABLE QUOTES ~ Match the quotation to the personality! 
BRAIN TEASERS ~ Cerebral conundrums for egg-heads to crack! 
WHO IN THE WORLD? ~ Guess the mystery person as the clues are read 
WHERE IN THE WORLD? ~ Guess where you are before it’s too late!

There are also six games featured on playing cards as follows: 
HUMM BUG ~ The hilarious tune-humming game 
CHARADES ~ A great version of this family favorite 
TOPIX ~ One topic, one letter... name as many examples as you can! 
CABOODLE ~ Be the last to play out your cards! 
TENSION ~ A subject and 10 examples ~ can you guess what they are? 
TALL TALES ~ The shaggy-dog-story-telling game

Includes: Audio CD, Card Deck, Answer Booklet & Score Pad

Name: After Dinner Games Compendium
Description:
From the publisher:
A collection of 6 great parlor games to tease and entertain your family and friends. 6 fun filled games of Bluff, Bluster, Definitions, Mime, Drawing, Fast Thinking and Shouting Out. Suitable for 2 or more players. Manufacturer's recommended age 12 years +.

Box Contents:
50 Shout It Out Cards
50 Stage Fright Cards
50 Scorching Scribbles Cards
50 Twaddle Cards
75 Forbidden Words Cards
25 Initial Quest Cards
20 Initial Quest Letter Tiles
20 Shout It Out Number Tiles
2 Shout It Out Counters
1 x 60 Second Timer
1 x 180 Second Timer
Score pads, Pencils and Rules Booklet

Name: Winflation:  The Consumer Survival Game
Description:
An extraordinarily rare game I recall playing as a child, Winflation' is little more than a fond memory for me now.  It belonged to a childhood friend--a gift from the designer, if I recall correctly--and I've never seen it in a store.

To the best of my recollection, there were similarities to roll 'n' move games such as PayDay or Life:  The board was a simple figure-eight track around which the playing pieces would move, and each space had some sort of action or consequence for the player; there were also free spaces that required no activity.  In addition, there were stock certificates that could be purchased and/or traded as well as cards to be drawn at certain points; the cards also had ramifications for the player, similar to the Chance/Community Chest cards in Monopoly.

I'm afraid I don't recall the specific mechanics--obviously the notion of inflation was part of the game--but the essential goal was to remain solvent and earn more money than your opponent(s).  My recollection is that the game ended when a certain period of time had passed, most likely defined by a set number of laps around the board.  I enjoyed the game quite a bit when I was a kid:  It seemed more sophisticated and complex than its roll 'n' move cousins, and I recall there being a number of potential activities to be undertaken with each turn.

I would love to hear from anyone else who has played this rare gem.  It was published by a company called Zany Eights Productions, Inc., in Pottstown, PA; I suspect that the first-and-only print run was very limited, and Zany Eights never published any other games, as far as I know.

edit:
From the Rules:
The object of the game is to be the last remaining played on the board who has survived week after week of spiraling inflation.  As inflation becomes worse and the cost of living increases, each player must meet his daily expenses, while making sure his salary keeps pace with current prices. Most Importantly, each player must keep his job in order to avoid certain financial disaster. Although provisions have been made for only six players, any number may participate. The amount of time required for each game varies with the rate of inflation.

Name: Dragon's Loot
Description:
From the publisher:

Players travel from castle to castle, capturing treasures from kings as they wind through a magical path on the game board. Dragon cards can help in the quest by allowing Dragons to steal treasure or to see clearly when flying at night under a bright moon. Beware! Sometimes Dragons have to give their treasure back or they meet up with Wizards and Knights determined to slay them.

Object of the Game
To compete against other Dragons and end up with the most loot!
Game Contents
Dragon's Loot Game Board, 1 Die, 4 Dragon Playing Pieces, 4 Dragon Cards, 44 Treasure Cards
